t: Luke 24
Resurrection Morning
On*p the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they came to the tomb, bringing the spices they had prepared.
They found the stone rolled away from the tomb.
They went in but did not find the body of the Lord Jesus.
While they were perplexed about this, suddenly two men stood by them in dazzling clothes.
So the women were terrified and bowed down to the ground. “Why*p are you looking for the living among the dead?” asked the men.
“He is not here, but he has risen! Remember how he spoke to you when he was still in Galilee,
saying, ‘It*r is*r necessary*r that*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r be*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r sinful*r men,*r be*r crucified,*r and*r rise*r on*r the*r third*r day’?”*r
And they remembered his words.
Returning*p from the tomb, they reported all these things to the Eleven and to all the rest.
Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the other women with them were telling the apostles these things.
But these words seemed like nonsense to them, and they did not believe the women.
Peter, however, got up and ran to the tomb. When he stooped to look in, he saw only the linen cloths. So he went away, amazed at what had happened.
The Emmaus Disciples
Now*p that same day two of them were on their way to a village called Emmaus, which was about seven miles from Jerusalem.
Together they were discussing everything that had taken place.
And while they were discussing and arguing, Jesus himself came near and began to walk along with them.
But they were prevented from recognizing him.
Then he asked them, “What*r is*r this*r dispute*r that*r you’re*r having*r with*r each*r other*r as*r you*r are*r walking?”*r And they stopped walking and looked discouraged.
The*p one named Cleopas answered him, “Are you the only visitor in Jerusalem who doesn’t know the things that happened there in these days?”
“What*rp things?”*r he asked them. So*p they said to him, “The things concerning Jesus of Nazareth, who was a prophet powerful in action and speech before God and all the people,
and how our chief priests and leaders handed him over to be sentenced to death, and they crucified him.
But we were hoping that he was the one who was about to redeem Israel. Besides all this, it’s the third day since these things happened.
Moreover, some women from our group astounded us. They arrived early at the tomb,
and when they didn’t find his body, they came and reported that they had seen a vision of angels who said he was alive.
Some of those who were with us went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said, but they didn’t see him.”
He*p said to them, “How*r foolish*r you*r are,*r and*r how*r slow*r to*r believe*r all*r that*r the*r prophets*r have*r spoken!*r
Wasn’t*r it*r necessary*r for*r the*r Messiah*r to*r suffer*r these*r things*r and*r enter*r into*r his*r glory?”*r
Then beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, he interpreted for them the things concerning himself in all the Scriptures.
They*p came near the village where they were going, and he gave the impression that he was going farther.
But they urged him, “Stay with us, because it’s almost evening, and now the day is almost over.” So he went in to stay with them.
It*p was as he reclined at the table with them that he took the bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them.
Then their eyes were opened, and they recognized him, but he disappeared from their sight.
They said to each other, “Weren’t our hearts burning within us while he was talking with us on the road and explaining the Scriptures to us?”
That very hour they got up and returned to Jerusalem. They found the Eleven and those with them gathered together,
who said, “The Lord has truly been raised and has appeared to Simon!”
Then they began to describe what had happened on the road and how he was made known to them in the breaking of the bread.
The Reality of the Risen Jesus
As*p they were saying these things, he himself stood in their midst. He said to them, “Peace*r to*r you!”*r
But they were startled and terrified and thought they were seeing a ghost.
“Why*r are*r you*r troubled?”*r he asked them. “And*r why*r do*r doubts*r arise*r in*r your*r hearts?*r

Look*r at*r my*r hands*r and*r my*r feet,*r that*r it*r is*r I*r myself!*r Touch*r me*r and*r see,*r because*r a*r ghost*r does*r not*r have*r flesh*r and*r bones*r as*r you*r can*r see*r I*r have.”*r
Having said this, he showed them his hands and feet.
But while they still were amazed and in disbelief because of their joy, he asked them, “Do*r you*r have*r anything*r here*r to*r eat?”*r
So they gave him a piece of a broiled fish,
and he took it and ate in their presence.

He*p told them, “These*r are*r my*r words*r that*r I*r spoke*r to*r you*r while*r I*r was*r still*r with*r you -*r that*r everything*r written*r about*r me*r in*r the*r Law*r of*r Moses,*r the*r Prophets,*r and*r the*r Psalms*r must*r be*r fulfilled.”*r
Then he opened their minds to understand the Scriptures.
He also said to them, “This*r is*r what*r is*r written:*r The*r Messiah*r will*r suffer*r and*r rise*r from*r the*r dead*r the*r third*r day,*r
and*r repentance*r for*r forgiveness*r of*r sins*r will*r be*r proclaimed*r in*r his*r name*r to*r all*r the*r nations,*r beginning*r at*r Jerusalem.*r
You*r are*r witnesses*r of*r these*r things.*r
And*r look,*r I*r am*r sending*r you*r what*r my*r Father*r promised.*r As*r for*r you,*r stay*r in*r the*r city*r until*r you*r are*r empowered*r from*r on*r high.”*r
The Ascension of Jesus
Then*p he led them out to the vicinity of Bethany, and lifting up his hands he blessed them.
And while he was blessing them, he left them and was carried up into heaven.
After worshiping him, they returned to Jerusalem with great joy.
And they were continually in the temple praising God.
